<xen:edithint template="option_list_option_onoff" />

{xen:phrase bdapi_subscription_confirm_deletion}: {$subscription.client_id} {xen:phrase bdapi_subscription_confirm_deletion} {$subscription.client_id}

{xen:phrase bdapi_subscription_please_confirm}:

{$subscription.client_id}

<xen:navigation> <xen:breadcrumb href="{xen:adminlink api-subscriptions}">{xen:phrase admin_navigation_bdApi_subscriptions}</xen:breadcrumb> </xen:navigation>
<xen:title>{xen:phrase bdapi_subscription_details} #{$subscription.subscription_id}</xen:title>
<xen:form action="{xen:adminlink 'api-subscriptions'}">
<xen:controlunit label="{xen:phrase bdapi_client}:">{$subscription.client_id}</xen:controlunit>
<xen:controlunit label="{xen:phrase bdapi_topic}:">{$subscription.topic}</xen:controlunit>
<xen:if is="{$subscription.expire_date} > 0"> <xen:controlunit label="{xen:phrase bdapi_expire_date}:"><xen:datetime time="{$subscription.expire_date}" /></xen:controlunit> </xen:if>
</xen:form>

{xen:phrase bdapi_subscriptions} {$client.name}

{xen:phrase bdapi_subscriptions}

{xen:phrase showing_x_of_y_items, 'count={xen:count $subscriptions}', 'total={xen:count $subscriptions}'}

{xen:phrase bdapi_subscription_no_results}
 {xen:adminpagenav $perPage, $total, $page, api-subscriptions, '', '_params={$pageNavParams}'}

<xen:foreach loop="$subscriptions" value="$subscription"> <xen:listitem id="{$subscription.subscription_id}" href="{xen:adminlink 'api-subscriptions/details', $subscription}" delete="{xen:adminlink 'api-subscriptions/delete', $subscription}"> <xen:label>{$subscription.topic}</xen:label> <xen:snippet>{xen:if '!{$client}', '{$subscription.client_name}->'}{$subscription.callback}</xen:snippet> </xen:listitem> </xen:foreach>

<xen:title>{xen:phrase bdapi_token_add}</xen:title>
<xen:form action="{xen:adminlink 'api-tokens/add'}" class="section AutoValidator" data-redirect="yes">
<xen:selectunit label="{xen:phrase bdapi_client}:" name="client_id"> <xen:options source="{$clients}" /> </xen:selectunit>
<xen:textboxunit label="{xen:phrase user_name}:" name="username" inputclass="AutoComplete AcSingle" />
<xen:checkboxunit label="{xen:phrase bdapi_scope}:" name="scopes"> <xen:foreach loop="$scopes" value="$scope"> <xen:option value="{$scope}">{xen:helper api_scopeGetText, $scope}</xen:option> </xen:foreach> </xen:checkboxunit>
<xen:spinboxunit label="{xen:phrase bdapi_ttl}:" name="ttl" value="3600" />
<xen:submitunit save="{xen:phrase bdapi_client_add}" />
<input type="hidden" name="_xfConfirm" value="1" /> </xen:form>

{xen:phrase bdapi_token_confirm_deletion}: {$token.token_text} {xen:phrase bdapi_token_confirm_deletion} {$token.token_text}

{xen:phrase bdapi_token_please_confirm}:

{$token.token_text}

{xen:phrase bdapi_tokens} {$client.name} + {xen:phrase bdapi_token_add}

{xen:phrase bdapi_tokens}

{xen:phrase showing_x_of_y_items, 'count={xen:count $allToken}', 'total={xen:count $allToken}'}

{xen:phrase bdapi_token_no_results}
 {xen:adminpagenav $perPage, $total, $page, api-tokens, '', '_params={$pageNavParams}'}

{$token.token_text} {xen:if '!{$client}', '{$token.client_name}->'}{xen:if '{$token.username}', $token.username, 'user#{$token.user_id}'} ({$token.scope}, {xen:datetime $token.issue_date})
  • {xen:phrase more_records_matching_filter_more_specific}

code_events.event:
Called after all default API routes have been registered.

Arguments:
  1. array &$routes - an array of reoutes.

phrases.phrase: Client could not be found. You can create one here and try again.
The requested Authentication Code could not be found
Please confirm that you want to delete the following authentication code
Client with this option enabled will be able to POST /search/indexing to put custom contents into XenForo search index.
Can subscribe for new user pings
The requested client content could not be found
No client content could be found...
Please confirm that you want to delete the following client content
Please confirm that you want to delete the all contents of this client:
API keys must be unique. The specified key is already in use.
API key must consist of lowercase alphanumeric characters (letters or numbers) only.
The requested Client could not be found

"Automatically authorize *-scope" options are dangerous because the system will bypass user confirmation dialog and will grant the client the requested scope. Please make sure to apply enough security measure to protect the key and secret for client with these kind of options enabled.
Please confirm that you want to delete the following client
A query is required: "ALTER TABLE `{table}` ADD COLUMN `{column}` MEDIUMBLOB".
Database column `{table}`.`{column}` could not be found for option {field}.

You are about to have a key pair generated by the system. Upon completion please save the private key securely, you will not be able to obtain it ever again (if the private key is lost, you will have to generate another key pair). The public key will be applied automatically to your client
By logging in, you will grant access to the listed client with the following permissions
The requested Log could not be found
The requested navigation element could not be found.
No user has been registered with this Facebook account.
No user has been registered with this Google account.
No user has been registered with this Twitter account.
This entry point only accepts POST requests.
Please confirm to grant access to the listed client with the following permissions

You are trying to authorize with no `client_id` therefore a random client of yours is being used. For security reason, the implicit grant flow is used and no other flows are available. Please confirm to continue.
Please save the Private Key securely, this is the only time it will be shown to you. If you lose it, you will have to generate a new key pair.
For JWT Bearer grant type, you can use a public / private key pair to authenticate the client.
You can either generate the key pair yourself or click here to have them prepared for you.
Public Key, if presents, must be valid.
The client has already been updated to use this Public Key.
The requested Refresh Token could not be found
Please confirm that you want to delete the following refresh token
Request must be authorized to encrypt data.
Read and start/reply to your conversations
Post contents (threads, posts) on behalf of you
Read information (forums, threads, posts) with your account's permissions
/batch requires valid JSON for jobs input.
/conversation-messages/attachments requires `conversation_id` for new message or `message_id` for existing message.
/posts/attachments requires `thread_id` for new post or `post_id` for existing post.
You cannot change Date of Birth.
PUT /users/:userId requires a valid `password_old`. Usage of `password_algo` is also highly recommended.
The requested subscription could not be found
Please confirm that you want to delete the following subscription
The requested Token could not be found
Please confirm that you want to revoke the following token
You can review and/or change {name}'s permissions below. Click {revoke} to completely remove {name} access to your account.

In addition to Redirect Uri, the system will also allow redirection to these domains. Each domain must be in a new line and may have wildcard, for example: "*.domain.com". To enable redirection to all domains, use "*" although it is not recommended for security reason.
You will be redirected back to {clientName}.
Enter the number of seconds before authentication code expires itself.

Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is a specification that enables truly open access across domain-boundaries. Enable this option to add the CORS headers to API responses. For more information regarding CORS, see here.
Enter the number of days to keep API log entries. If you don't want to log anything, enter 0 (zero).
Enter the default value for a request `limit` parameter.
Enter the maximum value for a request `limit` parameter. Enter 0 to have no limit.
Enter the maximum value for a request `page` parameter. Enter 0 to have no limit
Enter the number of days before refresh token expires itself.
Enable this option to deny access to the API if no authentication is provided. Guest access it still possible with One Time Token.
Enable this option to allow clients to subscribe for thread post changes.
Enable this option to allow clients to subscribe for user alerts.
Enable this option to allow clients to subscribe for user changes.
Enter the number of seconds before authentication code expires itself.

Enter a field in `xf_post` table to store the API Key of the client that created the post. You have to create the field with a query like this: "ALTER TABLE `xf_post` ADD COLUMN `bdapi_origin` VARCHAR(255)".

Enable this option to keep track of logged in user session if accessed via api entry points. Disabling this feature may result in improved server performance but will cause missing information for user last activities.
Enable this option to notify clients, who subscribed for user alerts, about conversation messages.
